title: Obituary : Yvonne Green
message:
An elegant figure dressed in black with a simple brooch, Green read with impassioned yet contained emotion.
Green also read her poem to the Knesset in Jerusalem and in Australia, at Sydney’s Sephardi community.
Her first pamphlet, Boukhara was published in 2007 and won the 2007 Poetry Business Book & Pamphlet Competition.
On July 3, 2017 Green read out Bejan Matur’s poems at The Kurdish Sisterhood event organised by the Exiled Lit Cafe at the Poetry Café.
Yvonne Green is survived by her husband Brian Green KC and their four children, Charlotte, Jasmine, Bertie and Rachael.

title: Friend of Goldberg - Polin keeps hope that he will be released
message:
“I wouldn’t want nobody else to drive the truck,” Smith said, clutching the Star of David around his neck.
He’s like, ‘Just for you, I’m gonna keep running.’”He even traveled with the family to Hersh’s bar mitzvah in Israel.
Hersh’s family had no idea if he was alive until April 24, when Hamas released a three-minute video of him in captivity.
“I had given up hope.”Hersh’s parents launched an international campaign, Bring Hersh Home, to raise awareness for the hostage crisis.
“But I’m just here to spread awareness about all the hostages.”The truck was concocted by Jeff Aeder, a close friend of Hersh’s family.

title: Chicago truck driver raises awareness for childhood friend held hostage in Gaza
message:
To Smith, he’s like a brother.
“I wouldn’t want nobody else to drive the truck,” Smith said, clutching the Star of David around his neck.
Hersh’s family had no idea if he was alive until April 24, when Hamas released a three-minute video of him in captivity.
“I had given up hope.”Hersh’s parents launched an international campaign, Bring Hersh Home, to raise awareness for the hostage crisis.
“But I’m just here to spread awareness about all the hostages.”The truck was concocted by Jeff Aeder, a close friend of Hersh’s family.
